"Australian musician (and oh, so much more) Clare Bowditch has turned her sharp mind to the pursuit of happiness for her fifth and most recent album, The Winter I Chose Happiness.
Dedicating two years of her life to the investigation of what makes us happy, Clare's research has seen her dabble with the concept that eating raw-food can make us happy, and a term known as neuro-plasticity - an area of brain science that suggests we can change our behaviour through changing our thoughts.
Produced by herself, and husband and band mate Marty Brown at their home-made recording studio, Standalone Studios in Coburg, Victoria, the record's theme was born from a collaboration Clare had with Wally de Backer, aka Gotye on one of the album's track, Are You Ready?.
Featuring a band that includes Tim Harvey on guitar, and Clare's Lady Garden chorus of female backing vocalists, The Winter I Chose Happiness is Clare Bowditch at her most personal, mining the depths of happiness, and sorrow for her art."
